name: Old Man Flynn
greeting: OLD MAN FLYNN: Did you know They Know?

options.responseText: OLD MAN FLYNN: I knew it! I knew someone would know! That brace looks like it needs a fair polishing. Let me give it a fair polishing, my son.
You nod politely and keep moving. They continue to know.
OLD MAN FLYNN: You... don't know? Then I have nothing to discuss with you.

options.text: 'From what I heard, they do NOT know, actually.'
options.responseText: Old Man Flynn uses his cane to bop you on the head. He then walks away.

name: Smith the Blacksmith
greeting: SMITH THE BLACKSMITH: Hello.

options.responseText: SMITH THE BLACKSMITH: You can see me?! No one has talked to me or looked at me in 50 years. Oh heavens this is incredible. I spend my days and nights sleeping and tending to various pieces of armor. All day. All Night. You have given me hope. Here, take this bracer. Its my best yet.
SMITH THE BLACKSMITH: Howdy.
SMITH THE BLACKSMITH: Howdy.
SMITH THE BLACKSMITH: Howdy.

name: Old Guy Accardi
greeting: OLD GUY ACCARDI: Have you seen my dog? His name is Artie. Honestly, heâ€™ll eat any food. He even eats the tops of strawberries. Also, he likes two clicks at the same time.

options.text: 'I have not seen him, but if I do, I'll run back here and let you know.'
options.responseText: OLD GUY ACCARDI: That's what's up. Thanks for telling me. As a reward, here is a sealed Health Potion I found earlier.
You nod politely and keep moving. You feel guilt because you DID in fact see Artie a few clicks ago. I hope you lose sleep.

Old Guy Accardi's smile turns to a deep and angry scowl. He says, 'You're going to eat those words,' makes a ton of noise to attract unwanted attention, and then throws a smoke bomb at his feet. He is now gone and in his place is something ready to kill you.

options.text: 'Yes. I saw him a few clicks back that way. Gave him a couple of pets on the noggin, I did.'
options.responseText: OLD GUY ACCARDI: That's what's up. Thank you for looking out. Here is a finder's fee.

name: TJ the Golden
greeting: TJ THE GOLDEN: Take a seat, will ya? I am cracking beers and listening to Steely Dan.

options.text: Take a seat, crack a beer, and listen to Steely Dan
options.responseText: Your mind and body are restored by a father's kindness and you gain +5 HP, and your vision is blurry from the delicious beer.

options.text: 'No thanks, I only like to Imagine the Dragon I am going to fight later.'
options.responseText: TJ THE GOLDEN: Alright. Suit yourself, padre.

options.text: 'No thanks, I have no time to learn the saxophone.'
options.responseText: TJ THE GOLDEN: They got a name for the winners in the world. I hope you have a name for when you lose.
Your mind and body are restored by a father's kindness and you gain +5 HP, and your vision is blurry from the delicious beer.

name: Fairwyn the Tongueless
greeting: FAIRWYN THE TONGUELESS: Oouu eeeahh ouu! Eerrr eh ah eehahee!!!

options.text: 'Did you say 'Look behind you, there is an enemy?'
options.responseText: There was, in fact, an enemy behind you.
You should have listened. An enemy appears, hits you with its claws, and runs away. You take damage.
You should have listened. An enemy appears, hits you with its claws, and runs away. You take damage.

options.text: 'I believe you with all of my soul even if I didn't understand what you said.'
options.responseText: You must have rested well last night because you knew what he meant before his tongueless mouth started flapping. You take your weapon and dig it into the enemy's skull, immediately dropping it back into the hell it came from, and you gain +5 HP.

name: Evil Tom
greeting: EVIL TOM: My name is Evil Tom. I'm a really nice guy. ðŸ˜ƒ

options.responseText: EVIL TOM: Well, I never!
Evil Tom sneezes and vanishes in a puff of smoke, leaving only a pair of old Crocs. The Crocs hurt to look at and deal 5 damage.
Evil Tom coughs so hard he accidentally punches you in the face and you take 5 damage.

options.text: 'You should change your name to Nice Tom then.'
options.responseText: EVIL TOM: Thank you. There is a lack of kindness in this world, and it's nice to meet someone who is counter to the culture. Here is some fresh bread.

name: Suttree The Old Mage
greeting: SUTTREE THE OLD MAGE: You look tired, traveler. Care for some arcane tea?

options.responseText: You feel energy surging through your veins.
You nod respectfully and continue on your way.
You nod disrespectfully and continue on your way.

options.text: Out of distrust of the world you live in, punch the Old Mage in the face.
options.responseText: The Mage doesn't seem to move or appear affected by your attack. However, your fist now aches. You move on awkwardly, losing -1 damage.

name: Daniel the Map Seller
greeting: DANIEL THE MAP GIVER: I give maps. Not much else.

options.responseText: It appears the map contains a shortcut through the upcoming brush. Your click count is reduced by 3.

options.text: 'The only guidance I need is from the sun and the stars.'
options.responseText: DANIEL THE MAP SELLER: Cool.
DANIEL THE MAP SELLER: Just maps.

options.text: Give me that compass or else I will make you pay!
options.responseText: DANIEL THE MAP SELLER: Ok, geeze... Here you go, man. Relax.

name: The Lost Bartender
greeting: THE LOST BARTENDER: Howdy, sir. How has your journey been? Never mind, forget I asked. Asking a man a question is the biggest true form of weakness, and I have been known to be a strong guy. Here, have a rip of this swill, won't you? I also have knives and guns and bullets you can drink if you want to.

options.text: Take a rip of the swill
options.responseText: Goes down smooth. Rips ya up on the inside in a good way.

options.text: Drink the guns, knives, and bullets.
options.responseText: THE LOST BARTENDER: Honestly, what did you expect? That's on you.

options.text: Take the guns, knives, and bullets and duct tape them to your chainmail gloves.
options.responseText: THE LOST BARTENDER: Very interesting.
THE LOST BARTENDER: Not even one knife? Okay then, pal.

name: Ron Von Zarovich
greeting: RON VON ZAROVICH: Bobby Lasagna is not to be trusted. I would sooner trust Strahd Von Zarovich over Bobby L. She lives in a hut and she killed my friend who once turned into a T-Rex.

options.responseText: RON VON ZAROVICH: Wow... Is this loss?
RON VON ZAROVICH: You could try. Here is some help. You'll end up vampire food, I fear. Good luck.

options.text: 'You shouldn't talk about your relations that way.'
options.responseText: RON VON ZAROVICH: You don't understand.

options.text: 'Well, if you think you are going to die, then maybe I can have your gold.'
options.responseText: RON VON ZAROVICH: Sure. What does it matter? These are the end times.

name: Miss Riddlesworth
greeting: MISS RIDDLESWORTH: You see me once in a minute, twice in a moment, but never in a thousand years. What am I?

options.responseText: MISS RIDDLESWORTH: Wrong!
MISS RIDDLESWORTH: H- How did you guess?
MISS RIDDLESWORTH: Not a chance!
MISS RIDDLESWORTH: You could not be more incorrect.

name: Mr Riddlesworth
greeting: MR RIDDLESWORTH: I build up castles, I tear down mountains. I make some men blind, I help others to see. What am I?

options.responseText: MR RIDDLESWORTH: Incorrect!
MR RIDDLESWORTH: Well, that's not the answer.
MR RIDDLESWORTH: You got it!
MR RIDDLESWORTH: Wrong!

name: The Scroll Dealer
greeting: THE SCROLL DEALER: If you're tired of looking at the same rocks and trees, then I may have a scroll for you...

options.responseText: THE SCROLL DEALER: Be careful out there...

name: Lord Bruenor Battlehammer
greeting: LORD BRUENOR BATTLEHAMMER: Good sir, I am Lord Bruenor Battlehammer, Lord of these lands and heir of King Bort Battlehammer. I confess I am lost. I understand being lost and a Lord of this land seems like something a crazy beggar would say, but I implore you, I am telling the truth! You seem like you know these lands better than most. Please, tell me which direction would be Castle Battlehammer?

options.text: 'My Lord, go past those bushes over there and through the clearing. You will be able to see your castle in the distance.'
options.responseText: LORD BRUENOR BATTLEHAMMER: Thank you, my dear friend. Here is a Turkey Leg from my finest Turkey. Come by any time and we can dine on a full Turkey!

options.text: 'This path will lead you there safely. You will just have to head the other direction, My Lord.'
options.responseText: LORD BRUENOR BATTLEHAMMER: Thank you, my dear friend. Come visit me anytime and I will show you how to harness the power of your highest ability!

options.text: 'These things happen, My Lord. However, I seem to be just as lost as you are, sadly.'
options.responseText: LORD BRUENOR BATTLEHAMMER: Thank you, my dear friend. Come visit me anytime and we will improve that sword of yours!

options.text: You distrust the raving madman. Why would a Lord of the lands be lost? You decide to attack the lunatic with your weapon.
options.responseText: It seems he was telling the truth. Off to jail you go, I suppose.

name: The Lighthouse Tavern
greeting: Just ahead, you spot a one-story building with what looks like a tall structure built to the left. The structure resembles a lighthouse. There is a handmade sign attached to the structure that says 'The Lighthouse Tavern'. You infer the tall structure is where this place got its name. Walking into the bar, there are a few patrons: a farmhand, a dwarf, and a mysterious man sitting in the shadows. The barkeep smiles at you. The bartender appears to be selling Beer and Boiled Peanuts. As you approach the bar, the mysterious man appears to also have something for sale...

options.text: Buy a beer from the Barkeep (10 Gold)
options.responseText: 'I'll take a Beer, please.'.
I'll take a Hardtack, please.

options.text: Buy the mysterious item from the Mysterious Man
options.responseText: The item looks like a normal compass, except it's glowing slightly. You walk outside with the compass, and without warning, you are transported to another area.
THE BARKEEP: Be careful of the goblins on this road, traveler.

name: A Cute Dog
greeting: 'woof'

options.text: 'Hey I think a guy is looking for you.'
options.responseText: The dog doesn't appear to be a dog after all and morphs into a disgusting creature.
The dog doesn't appear to be a dog after all and morphs into a disgusting creature.
The dog doesn't appear to be a dog after all and morphs into a disgusting creature.
You must have smelled something fishy because the dog was an enemy in disguise. The 'dog' dies immediately and drops a Turkey Leg, for some reason.

name: Dead Body
greeting: In front of you, there is a dead body. You recognize the person as Dr. Agula, a doctor from your village. Dr. Agula does not appear to have decayed much which indicates this may have happened recently. You hear about witches in this area and wonder if thats what did him in. The Doctor is out, it seems.

options.responseText: You take the dead man's Padded Armor
You take the dead man's gold.

options.text: Dig through some ditches and bury the Doctor. Say a prayer, swear you will burn through whatever witches did this to the Doctor and move on.
options.responseText: 'Rest in Peace, Rob Agula.'
Nothing Happens because its a dead body.

name: Hanni Aebi
greeting: New face in town, aren't you? My name's Hanni Aebi. Come, sit a spell, and tell me what brings you to our humble village.

start.text: New face in town, aren't you? My name's Hanni Aebi. Come, sit a spell, and tell me what brings you to our humble village.

options.text: I'm fine, thank you. Just passing through.
options.responseText: Hanni nods kindly. 'Safe travels then, dearie. May your path be clear.'

village_backstory.text: Oh, this village has seen many seasons. We're nestled right at the foot of the Whisperwind Peaks, you see. Long ago, they say ancient spirits dwelled there, protecting us from the creeping shadows of the Sunken City. It's quieter now, but the old ways linger. We will know the shadows are back if our young ones start disappearing. The shadows crave innocent minds. But so far, no missing children!

options.text: That's enough history for now. Can you help me?
Thank you for the stories. I should go.
options.responseText: Hanni smiles warmly. 'Anytime, dearie. Come back if you need a warm word or a helping hand.'

sunken_city_lore.text: The Sunken City... a tragic tale. It was once a grand kingdom, swallowed by the earth and sea in a single night. Some say it was a curse, others, a forgotten magic. Best not to dwell on such things too long; they tend to draw unwanted attention.

options.text: That's enough history for now. Can you help me?

options.responseText: Hanni nods, her expression thoughtful. 'Indeed. Some stories are best left untold.'

healing_offer.text: Oh, you poor thing! You look a bit rough. I've got some remedies. What do you need?

options.responseText: Hanni presses a warm poultice into your hand. 'There, that should help with the aches. No charge, dearie.'
Hanni produces a small, glowing vial. 'This special brew will set you right. Just 10 gold, for my troubles.'

options.text: Do you have any ale? (2 Gold, +15 HP)
options.responseText: Hanni chuckles, pulling out a tankard. 'Always got some homebrew for a parched throat! Just 2 gold, but it's strong stuff!'

name: The Mysterious Cave
greeting: A narrow opening, almost hidden by thick vines, leads into a dark cave. A faint, earthy smell wafts from within, along with a whisper of cool air.

start.text: A narrow opening, almost hidden by thick vines, leads into a dark cave. A faint, earthy smell wafts from within, along with a whisper of cool air.

options.responseText: You decide your journey is too important. You continue on.

cave_entrance.text: The darkness inside is absolute, broken only by the drip of water. You can barely make out two paths ahead: one narrow and winding, the other wider and leading deeper.

options.text: This is too spooky. I'm leaving.
options.responseText: The cave's eerie silence is too much. You carefully backtrack and exit the cave.

narrow_path.text: You squeeze through a tight passage. The passage seems to become more and more narrow as you go on.

options.text: Give up and return to the entrance.

narrow_path_outcome.text: You manage to catch yourself and regroup.

options.responseText: You proceed further, finding nothing else of note at the moment. The path eventually leads you out of the cave.

wide_path.text: The wider path leads to a large cavern. In the center, a faint light flickers, revealing a strange altar.

options.text: Decide it's too dangerous and turn back.

wide_path_outcome.text: The alter glows, shakes and emits a heat that plucks every pore on your skin.

options.responseText: 'You'll learn to regret touching my altar!'

options.text: 'I don't want any part of this. I am outta here.'

name: The Drunken Dragon Inn
greeting: As you push open the heavy wooden door, the warm, boisterous air of 'The Drunken Dragon Inn' washes over you. Laughter, clinking tankards, and the murmur of countless conversations fill the room. Travelers and dock workers alike are gathered, sharing tales and drinks. The barkeep nods a greeting from behind a polished counter.

start.text: The Drunken Dragon Inn is a lively place. The smell of roasted meat and ale hangs heavy in the air. What's your pleasure?

options.text: Order a hearty ale and find a quiet corner to listen.
options.responseText: You enjoy a fine, free ale, the blur of the drink helping you relax as you soak in the atmosphere. You feel a little healthier. The night passes peacefully.

options.text: Approach the rosy-cheeked dwarf at the end of the bar.
Leave the tavern. It's too loud for you.
options.responseText: You prefer the quiet of the road. You slip out, leaving the merriment behind.

talk_to_mornik.text: You sidle up to the dwarf, who looks up with a grin. 'Well, hello there, stranger! Name's Mornik Ironaxe. Care for a drink? On me!' He shoves a tankard of potent-smelling brew into your hand.

options.responseText: You take a long swig of the free ale. It's strong, but surprisingly refreshing, and you feel a little healthier. Mornik claps you on the back.
Mornik shrugs. 'Suit yourself. More for me, then!' He goes back to his ale.

mornik_conversation.text: Mornik, now a fast friend, launches into a series of wild tales about his mining days, interrupted only by more rounds of drinks. The night blurs into a haze of laughter and increasingly improbable stories. You feel your head getting heavy...

options.text: Try to keep up with Mornik's drinking.
options.responseText: You match Mornik drink for drink. The world spins, and the last thing you remember is a loud dwarf singing about a pickaxe. You feel a tiny bit healthier from all the free ale.

options.text: Ask Mornik about his life as a dwarf.
Excuse yourself and try to find a room for the night.
options.responseText: You manage to stumble to a vacant room just before passing out. A rough but restful night.

mornik_life_start.text: Mornik's eyes twinkle. 'Ah, me lad/lass, a dwarf's life is a simple one, full of rock, ale, and the occasional goblin skirmish. But there's more to it than that... What do ye wish to hear?'

options.text: Tell me more about the rock and mining.
What about the goblins and skirmishes?

options.responseText: Mornik grins. 'Aye, a fine choice!'
You bid Mornik farewell, feeling a little wiser.

mornik_rock_tales.text: He recounts tales of deep delves, finding rare gems, and the echoes of ancient pickaxes. 'A good shield, that's what keeps ye safe in the dark! My old dwarven shield, it's seen many a scrape, but it's still sturdy.'

options.text: I could use a good shield.
options.responseText: Mornik grunts. 'Aye, take this old thing. It's seen a few scrapes, but it'll serve ye well.' You gain +1 Defense.
You thank Mornik for his stories and head out.

mornik_goblin_tales.text: Mornik's face darkens slightly as he speaks of cunning goblins and narrow escapes. 'Always keep yer wits about ye, and never trust a shiny object that ain't gold! They're tricksters, those green skins.'

options.text: Any advice on dealing with them?
options.responseText: Mornik shares a secret dwarven combat trick, restoring some of your special ability charges. You feel more prepared for the road ahead.
You thank Mornik for his stories and head out.

wake_up_hangover.text: The morning sun is blinding. You groan, your head pounding like a blacksmith's hammer. You're not in a bed. You're lying on a pile of leaves, surrounded by trees. You're in the woods, and you have no idea how you got here. And you feel a bit worse for wear.
wake_up_hangover.responseText: A truly epic hangover. You take 3 damage from the ordeal. The tavern is nowhere in sight.

options.responseText: You shake your head, trying to clear the fog, and stumble forward, leaving the mystery of last night behind.

name: The Bard's Library Karaoke
greeting: You step into the grand hall of the Bard's Library, usually a place of quiet study, but tonight it's abuzz with an unusual energy. A makeshift stage is set up, and a sign reads: 'Karaoke Contest. Master the Ballad of the Wandering Blade.'

start.text: The air vibrates with nervous excitement and off-key singing. A cheerful gnome gestures towards the stage. 'Care to try your hand, traveler? Tonight, we seek the finest rendition of 'Molly Malone'. Winner gets 100 Gold Pieces!'

options.text: Sign up for the contest despite not knowing the song at all.

options.responseText: You politely decline, deciding to leave the stage to the more musically inclined. The library's usual quiet calls to you.

options.text: Just listen to the other contestants.
options.responseText: You find a comfortable spot and enjoy the spectacle, chuckling at some of the more enthusiastic, if untalented, performers.

pick_song.text: The gnome directs you to the stage where some 50 patrons half drunk cheer. The small band in the corner begins the song as the crowd sings the first line 'In Dublin's fair city, Where the girls are so pretty, I first set my eyes on sweet Molly Malone' and they await for you to belt out the next line...

options.text: Sing: 'As she wheeled her wheel-barrow, Through streets broad and narrow, Crying: Cockles and mussels, alive, alive, oh!
Sing: 'As she ate a squirrel, Through streets full of barrels, Sighing: Rocks and muskrats, alive, alive, oh!'
Dont sing and instead begin sweating and anxiously shaking.'

line_1.text: The crowd begins clapping along moderately and singing along: 'Alive, alive, oh, Alive, alive, oh! Crying Cockles and mussels, alive, alive, oh!'

options.text: Sing: 'She was a nice mother, But sure 'twas no father, For so were her brother and sister before'
Sing: 'She was a fishmonger, But sure 'twas no wonder, For so were her father and mother before'
Dont sing and instead vomit off stage left and run out of the Library.

line_2.text: The crowd begins wildly singing back: 'And they each wheel'd their barrow, Through streets broad and narrow'

options.text: Sing back to the crowd: 'Sighing: Rocks and muskrats, alive, alive, oh!'
Sing back to the crowd: 'Crying Cockles and mussels alive, alive oh!'

line_3.text: The crowd is out of control. The floor is being scuffed with the amount of feet scraping in rhythm and neighbors nearby are poking their heads in a sleepy eyed state as the crowd sings back to you 'She died of a fever and no one could save her. And that was the end of sweet Molly Malone!'.

options.text: Sing: 'But her goat wheels her barrow, Through streets made of marrow, Crying Socks filled of muscle, alive, alive, oh!'
Sing: 'But her ghost wheels her barrow, Through streets broad and narrow, Crying, Cockles and mussels, alive, alive, oh!'

win_contest.text: The crowd is in a steady roar. The gnome is running toward you with a big pouch of gold. He is jumping up and down shouting 'You win! You Win! Here is your prize!'

options.responseText: You receive a heavy pouch of 100 gleaming gold pieces! Your vocal cords might be sore, but your purse is certainly not, and you've earned the respect of the bards present.

lose_contest.text: A collective groan rises from the audience. The gnome sighs. Better luck next time.

options.responseText: Well, at least a Bandit wasn't swiping at me with a sword. I guess it wasn't all bad.
